column4: will dapper fix the problem of firefox spontaneously closing, and too much activity resulting in a random system crash?
well, for the too much activity resulting crash.. that's better than in breezy to me anyways.
is there any simple reason for that?  at least good to know that I'm not the only one having that problem
I guess it's because that's the first thing programmed to close if there's a need to free memory.
really, it's cuz I don't have enough ram?
I think so, but I couldn't say.
seems to happen even when I don't have much open
yeah. I had that a lot in breezy.
You need to mount the drive and well.. then it just there to read.
Dapper does that automatically and places symlink to your desktop.
oh, is that all?  things are always just so simple...
I forget, how do I check my hard drive's partitions again?
in case anyone didn't already tell you: fdisk -l /dev/hdX
you want to add your windows partition into fstab of course.
